intro: Guajava multiflora, commonly known as the tropical evergreen tree, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas and is characterized by its dense foliage and fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, clustered white or pinkish flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its fruit, a small, round berry, is edible and has a sweet, tart flavor. Guajava multiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
